description.text:
Primary responsibilities included prioritizing and planning complete building services for a FDA manufacturing client in accordance with Good Manufacturing and Safe Practices.  Served as the point of contact for all projects, contractors, and the client to ensure proper resources were secured and client services were satisfied. Coached, trained, and developed multi-skilled team members including identifying skill gaps and coaching individual development. Assisted to develop budgets, track/approve expenses, and forecast repairs/maintenance. Managed the 360 Facility CMMS. Successfully lead and supported company and client compliance audits. In the absence of an Operations Manager assumed daily and project related responsibilities to meet the contract and client needs. 

•	Spearheaded the development and implementation of 360 Facility CMMS consisting of 2500+ assets.

description.text: Oversight of Inova Fairfax Medical Campus (2.8 million sqft) which includes Inova Fairfax Hospital, Inova Heart and Vascular Institute, Inova Women's Hospital, Inova Children's Hospital as well as Northern Virginia only Level One Trauma Center. Also provide EOC support to 29 off-site clinics and facilities. Responsibilities include non-clinical ancillary support groups Engineering, Emergency Preparedness, Safety and Security, Environmental Services, Material Management, Volunteer Services, Gift Shops, Food Services, Patient Transportation, Parking Services, Greeters as well as all subgroups of each department.

Meet regularly with Facility Administration to report on program progress. Actively participate in all related Facility Committees. Meet regularly, both formally and informally, with all department heads and key facility people. Produce desired results timely and within budgeted guidelines. Complete recommended amounts of Quality Control inspections to insure an efficient operation. Provide all necessary reports, payroll records, training records, Quality Control reports and all other departmental documentation to Administration and home office on a timely basis. Coordinate necessary sub-contract services. Update staff job descriptions and duties and responsibilities as needed to meet the requirements and objectives. Update and/or develop policies and procedures to comply with the requirements and objectives.Update and maintain a list of dependable contractors and supplies to assure timely emergency response turn-around and cost effective renovation, repair and maintenance performance.Develop plans and systems to understand and met Joint Commission, OSHA, regulatory agency, fire, safety and environmental code requirements. Establish PM requirements for all applicable house-wide equipment and conduct inspections and audits to assure equipment is maintained properly and timely to accomplish long useful lives and a safe, comfortable, and attractive environment. Conduct concurrent oversight to assure customer comfort and safety is addressed and met. Monitor staff performance via computer productivity reports and personal observations with timely conclusions and follow-up. Prepare and make presentations relative to the annual capital, staffing and operating budget. Maintain current and up to date on changes in the industry regarding Regulatory Agency recommendations/standards.

Responsible for the management of services, processess and building repairs throughout all buildings occupied by DUMC. Coordinates and lead a team or teams of staff members in prioritizing and complete of work orders.

experience.title: Senior Director, Finance Operations, MedStar Medical Group

description.text: Leads Financial Planning and Analysis for Hospital Aligned Physician Practices.  Works collaboratively with Physicians and Operations leaders as a teacher, coach, mentor, and trusted advisor to optimize financial performance.

Act as financial liaison for over ninety key operational departments within a not-for-profit 400-bed community teaching hospital.
Coordinate the accurate and timely development of the fiscal operating budget and conduct monthly actual to plan variance analysis for key departments, incorporating projection of volumes, revenue, salary, and non-manpower expenses.
Collaborate with Strategic Planning and Senior Management to assist in the preparation and submission of a cohesive long-range financial forecast, with special focus on volumes, revenue, and contributions.
Manage Decision Support System process, involving data collection and validation, model set-up, preparation and loading of reclassifications and statistical allocations, performing calculations, and completing reconciliations.  Utilize data to provide Corporate Finance with service line profitability and special requests.  
Prepare return on investment business plans, documenting supporting assumptions, to aide Senior Management in decision making regarding profitability and growth opportunities.
Analyze financial statements during the monthly close process to ensure complete, accurate, timely, and appropriate financial reporting to management, specifically completing drill down and trending analysis of monthly Case Mix Index by Product Line, Other Operating Revenue, and Salary Expense.
Partner with Case Management, Risk Management, and Rates and Reimbursement to monitor pay for performance methodologies, as it relates to Readmissions and Potentially Preventable Conditions.
Seek opportunities for improvement and establish productivity targets utilizing the Action O-I national benchmarking tool and Kaufman Hall productivity tool.
Collaborate with Internal Audit regarding payroll and accounts payable investigations.
Educate new leaders on financial reporting and the budgeting process.  Mentor fellow associates.

Embraced multiple reorganizations gaining experience in Financial Planning and Analysis, Managed Care Analysis, and Actuarial Reporting.  Mentored and trained fellow associates, supervised interns, and acted as a team leader.
Coordinated the accurate and timely development of the corporate financial plan and investigated monthly actual to plan trends, volume/rate, and product mix variances, creating various models to perform “what if” analyses.
Designed and analyzed cost of care and financial/actuarial reports for upper management or external release, under critical time restraints, including profit/loss statements, detailed cost allocation models, annual statement exhibits, and other regulatory reports.
Successfully led Actuarial/Financial Reporting team in monthly close process, involving estimation of incurred but not reported (IBNR) for all entities, segments and products, incorporating chain and ladder model.
Developed and maintained database for use in planning, segment reporting/monitoring, and drill down analysis.
Communicated with hospitals regarding advance financing and represented team on Substantial, Available and Affordable Coverage (SAAC) task force.
Assisted the Actuarial Pricing team through coordination of a competitive pricing analysis, development and testing of rates, and answering broker inquiries.
Organized special ad hoc financial projects, analyzed corporate and industry trends, prepared statistics used in the request for proposal process, and supported financial settlements and external audit.
Prepared numerous presentations for upper management.

experience.title: Category Manager IT and Telecom Services

description.text: Manage a team of IT sourcing professionals, direct workflow and assign work responsibilities to the team members as well as provide assistance and guidance to business partners and leaders.  Negotiate and manage the contractual commitments for Infrastructure and Voice/Data hardware, software and services.  Execute best-in-class sourcing strategies for the IT and Telecom Services areas to include: identification of sourcing projects, conducting risk management/due diligence, leveraging electronic tools and technology (such as on-line bidding/e-Sourcing), leading price and contract negotiations, recommend and influence  decisions.  Knowledge and understanding of the market for assigned spend categories.

As a cognitive supply chain company, Pensiamo was formed by spinning out the UPMC Supply Chain Organization and partnering with a commercial supply chain organization to offer services to clients’ supply chain leaders and deliver custom solutions that help solve their most challenging needs. Pensiamo seeks to elevate and extend each customer’s supply chain to deliver best-in-class value; contributing meaningfully to excellence in patient care by utilizing market leading technologies, performance metrics, optimized processes and strategic partnerships. Pensiamo provides comprehensive source-to-settle solutions, including Category Management, Strategic Sourcing, Contract and Supplier Management, Spend Analytics, P2P and Mergers/Acquisitions. The vision that has led to the creation of Pensiamo, an integrated Supply Chain Management organization, evolved from the success of UPMC's world class supply chain management and operations. The inspiration for creating Pensiamo was driven by the necessity to deliver material value to healthcare providers beyond the capabilities of traditional GPO and consulting providers.

Management of the strategic sourcing activities and oversight of contracts for end user computing, servers/storage/software and infrastructure, digital assests (eBooks and eLearning tools), construction & design for the corporations' four education brands that included 105 locations in 32 states and 1 canadian province.

Directed sourcing initiatives to launch private label products in the healthcare and safety divisions.  Developed sourcing and merchandising strategies for product introduction, logistics, purchasing and inventory with the respective divisions to ensure successful penetration in the marketplace.

activities.text: Attended the excelerated Master's program in business administration with and emphasis in information technology management.  Worked primarily within a cohort group throughout the classes in the program for successful completion.

description.text:
𝘔𝘦𝘥𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘳 𝘪𝘴 𝘢𝘯 𝘕𝘍𝘗 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘭𝘵𝘩𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘰𝘳𝘨𝘢𝘯𝘪𝘻𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘰𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳 300 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘭𝘵𝘩𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘦𝘴, 𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘭𝘶𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 10 𝘩𝘰𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘴 𝘢𝘤𝘳𝘰𝘴𝘴 𝘉𝘢𝘭𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘞𝘢𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘵𝘰𝘯.

Under the President of MMG's leadership, overseeing a budget of up to $2B and 10 direct reports steering strategic growth initiatives and ensuring operational excellence across a multi-specialty medical group.

▪Directed MMG's executive leadership team, strategically governing a diverse portfolio of over 38 specialties across 300+ care sites, elevating operational efficiency and financial performance for multiple pillars of healthcare service delivery. 
▪Executed a tactical business plan to establish a flagship multi-specialty Medical Office facility, consolidating operations, introducing new service lines, and securing a multi-year lease on schedule and under budget constraints.
▪Partnered with the President of MedStar Ambulatory Services to enhance multi-specialty and ambulatory surgery center operations, fostering efficient care delivery and patient-centric services.
▪Headed the reorg, scalability, and optimization of the patient call center operations centralizing under a unified infrastructure; deployed a system-wide service line approach to patient access, yielding a 5% baseline improvement, 7-fig net revenue, and value performance gain.

𝘜𝘜𝘎 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘧 𝘶𝘳𝘰𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦, 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘳𝘦𝘩𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘢 𝘯𝘦𝘵𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘰𝘧 𝘤𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘮𝘣𝘶𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘺 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘨𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭 𝘤𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘴.

In partnership with the Board, CEO, and physician leadership, managed a  $350M revenue portfolio and 10 senior executives leading the strategic development and implementation of financial and operational objectives across 4 states, 52 clinics, and 20 Ambulatory Centers.

▪Steered the acquisition and integration of three independent urology group practices, merging IT, HRIS, and Patient Contact Center systems, yielding a 5% net rate increase and expansion of national presence.
▪Developed and implemented a comprehensive operational plan, accelerating growth initiatives, market expansion, and practice integration processes, establishing UUG as the leading consolidated urology practice in the US.
▪Oversaw EBITDA value creation, driving profitability through clinical service line expansions, operational scalability enhancements, targeted marketing,  and sales campaigns; created significant revenue growth and margin improvement.

Strategic and operational consulting, short-term contracts/projects and full-time augmentation engagements, delivering immediate value ahead of and alongside program, service and new business builds. Providing foundational readiness for early-stage and ongoing growth initiatives, our startup engine, program accelerator offering is driven by solid team expertise and practical know-how in all areas of healthcare innovation,  telehealth, and system-of-care integration.
 
HIVE Prep - Accreditation & Compliance Service:
Preparing for telemedicine accreditation through ATA, URAC, or for a TJC, NCQA survey? Need to maintain compliance? HIVE Prep provides expertise and ongoing support to help meet standardized requirements. Assistance in defining scope of practice, documenting clinical protocols, operational workflows, quality measures and policies & procedures.
 
HIVE Accelerator - Start-Up Readiness Engine:
Get "there"​ faster and avoid common pitfalls - the HIVE Accelerator delivers assessment, strategic execution plans, operational tools and business processes needed to get a jump on launching or growing your healthcare service or solution. End-to-end delivery of the service accelerator. Brokering 3rd-party resources, service delivery partners, technology delivery partners, as needed.
 
HIVE MedStaff - Physician Licensing, Credentialing & Privileging Solution:
Management of your physician licensing, credentialing & privileging tasks. Documentation of on-boarding requirements, clinical best practices, technical/operational workflows, and system training. Analytical tools to measure provider quality and productivity.

http://www.hiveconnectedhealth.com

Serve as expert advisor to the organization executives. Perform overall assessment of organization operational processes. Responsible for building operational infrastructure of the clinical operations team that includes credentialing, accreditation, scheduling, provider recruiting, provider relations. Lead day-to-day operations of the medical team. Identify and develop strategic direction for clinical team to ensure organization goals and financial targets are achieved. Builds strong collaborative partnerships internally and externally. Establish performance metrics and develop audit and compliance programs for organization. Identify and advise on key performance improvement areas and recommend solutions.

experience.title: Vice President of Credentialing, Licensing, & Privileging

description.text:
VP of Credentialing, Licensing & Privileging for telemedicine 
★ Installed new credentialing system to increase productions and quality metrics.
★ Tripled physician privileging portfolio
★ Achieved The Joint Commission re-certification with a 100% score in credentialing.
★ Developed a physician regionalization plan that yielded increased provider response time and patient outcome.

♦ Corporate executive leader responsible for all credentialing, licensing, and privileging of SOC physicians to effectively administer national telemedicine services across a variety of clinical specialties (neurology, psychiatry, cardiology, critical care). 
♦ Overall leadership and development of SOC credentialing standards, processes, and performance metrics. 
♦ Collaborated with clinical leads to develop and implement physician’s licensing and privileging plans to ensure optimal coverage for clinical consults. 
♦ Partnered with federal regulators on initiatives that streamline and bring improvement to the overall administration of telemedicine services in healthcare. Lead the organization through The Joint Commission in Ambulatory Care re-certification process. 
♦ Represented the organization on credentialing, licensing, and privileging initiatives that allows for greater efficiency and develop industry standards for telemedicine (i.e., compact licensing, credentialing by proxy). 
♦ Identifying revenue generating opportunities that compliments and supports SOC’s vision.

Senior Director of Network Operations
★ Achieved Magellan's first HMO License by ensuring adequate provider network, compliant credentialing protocols and successfully participated in the Florida state review.
★ Led the credentialing department through a cultural transformation that yielded increased employee morale and job satisfaction. Recognized by CEO for exceptional leadership in transforming the Credentialing Verification Organization (CVO) through creating an environment of trust thereby improving employee performance.
★ Led the CVO through 3 NCQA re-certifications with a 100% score.

♦ Led reductions in administrative expenses due to enhancements in automation, technology and business processes. 
♦ Championed, analyzed and implemented work flow management software leading to enhanced FTE productivity. 
♦ Implemented reasonable expectations for performance for production staff
♦ Led Accreditation and Compliance team which was responsible for the overall quality, efficiency and performance of network operations functions, including credentialing, contract management and new business and product implementations.

section_components.subtitle: Healthcare Exec; HR Thought Leader, Author, Writer, and Speaker

fixedListComponent.text: It is my pleasure to recommend Brinder Singh. We were introduced as he began an Administrative Residency within Inova's Learning, Education and OD function. While Brinder did not report to me directly, we had many occasions to work closely and I had ample opportunity to judge his work and work ethic. I recall that Brinder was, indeed, gifted. He is articulate and persuasive, as well as very, very smart, resourceful, and ethical.  Moreover, Brinder is extremely likable and personable. Such qualities bode well for a future manager and executive leader. Beyond his ever-present "yes" attitude to work, work and more work, Brinder was always the one to offer to help his teammates problem solve, to provide additional analysis or even just a quick smile of encouragement to harried colleagues. It is no surprise to me that Brinder Singh has become so successful so early on in his career. I have no doubt, whatsoever, that his career trajectory will continue to impress.  I recommend Brinder enthuiastically, without reservation.

section_components.caption: June 4, 2010, Brinder worked with Ellen (McVeigh) on the same team
section_components.subtitle: Healthcare Exec; HR Thought Leader, Author, Writer, and Speaker

fixedListComponent.text: “I had the privilege of working for Ellen while we were both at the Inova Health System. As an administrative intern for my MHA residency program, I have always looked at Ellen as one of my mentors. As a mentor, Ellen created opportunities and opened doors for me. As a young graduate student you often don’t know which door to knock on. You aren’t familiar with the opportunities out there nor do you really have any connections. I could always knock on Ellen’s door! Ellen created opportunities for me, recognized my strengths and abilities and set me up for success. I have always admired her dedication, ability to lead others as well as her commitment to healthcare excellence. She is remarkably insightful, a visionary who is always promoting positive change with results. Ellen was always there for me as a graduate student and continues to be there for me today. I recommend Ellen without reservation as a leader, a colleague, and a mentor.”  Good Luck Ellen! Brinder Singh

linkedin_data.name: Candice Vance, MBA, CHRC
linkedin_data.headline: Over fifteen years of experience in post award research administration; revenue cycle and billing compliance.
linkedin_data.summary:
I am passionate about financial compliance, specifically in healthcare.  I have an MBA with a concentration in Health Services Administration and a Bachelor's degree in Accounting.  I am also a Certified Professional Coder (CPC), and have a certification in healthcare research compliance (CHRC). I am currently working as the Sr. Director of Research Revenue Cycle and eResearch Systems at MedStar Health Research Institute. Over the years, I have actively contributed to building compliance programs, training programs, process improvement, implementing new systems, including Peoplesoft (Oracle), a clinical trial management system (OnCore), transitioning EMRs (Cerner to EPIC), and developing the APIs between those systems.

On a personal level, I am passionate about equity and giving back to our communities.  I serve as the Chair of the MedStar Health Research Institute EI&D Council, and I serve on the Board of Directors of the Family Crisis Center in Baltimore County.

qualified_prospects.search_title: Stuart Levine - President at MedStar Franklin Square ...
qualified_prospects.search_snippet: Stuart M. Levine, MD, FACP, was named President at MedStar Franklin Square Medical Center after serving as President and Chief Medical Officer of MedStar ...

linkedin_data.name: Stuart Levine
linkedin_data.headline: President at MedStar Franklin Square Medical Center
linkedin_data.summary:
Stuart M. Levine, MD, FACP, was named President at MedStar Franklin Square Medical Center after serving as President and Chief Medical Officer of MedStar Harbor Hospital since 2017. He remains a Senior Vice President of MedStar Health. He formerly served as the vice president of Medical Affairs and Chief Medical Officer at both MedStar Franklin Square Medical Center and MedStar Harbor Hospital. Previously, Dr. Levine served as the vice chairman of Strategic Growth and Research in the Department of Medicine at both MedStar Good Samaritan and MedStar Union Memorial Hospitals, and as medical director of the Good Health Center at MedStar Good Samaritan Hospital.

Prior to joining MedStar Health in 2010, Dr. Levine served as a faculty member and assistant professor of medicine in the Division of Rheumatology at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, where he also served as co-director of the Johns Hopkins Vasculitis Center. 

Dr. Levine received his medical degree from Columbia University’s College of Physicians and Surgeons, and completed his internship and residency at Johns Hopkins Hospital, as well as a fellowship in rheumatology at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. He is a fellow of the American College of Physicians and a member of the American College of Rheumatology, American Medical Association and the American Association for Physician Leadership. He is also a member of the American College of Healthcare Professionals.

Dr. Levine’s research has been published in several peer-reviewed journals, including PLOS One, Arthritis and Rheumatology, The Journal of Rheumatology, Seminars in Arthritis and Rheumatism, and The American Journal of Medicine. Dr. Levine received a K08 Mentored Clinical Scientist Development Award from the National Institutes of Health for his work on immune responses in autoimmune myositis.

linkedin_data.name: Wendy McAtee, CHRC
linkedin_data.headline: Research Compliance Director at MedStar Health
linkedin_data.summary:
With over 20 years of research experience, Wendy McAtee brings her expertise in research conflicts of interest, research billing compliance, human subjects protection, and research integrity to her role as the research compliance director for all MedStar Health investigators and research associates. 

Wendy is responsible for providing education to researchers on her areas of expertise while implementing MedStar Health’s research compliance and privacy programs to ensure federal laws, regulations, policies and procedures are followed. Wendy conducts investigations of research patients’ privacy concerns, allegations of potential research misconduct and research non-compliance. Annually, Wendy facilitates a research compliance risk assessment and develops a research compliance work plan. Wendy is the co-chair of the Regulatory and Research Integrity Oversight Committee as well as the Research Compliance Committee.

Wendy has a Bachelor of Science in Health Science from Clemson University and maintains her Healthcare Research Compliance Certification.

skills.name: U.S. Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

description.text:
Conduct research billing compliance audits to ensure accordance with institutional process and policies, Medicare Research Billing Guidelines, Clinical Trial Agreements (CTA), and Prospective Reimbursement Analyses (PRA).
Lead Research Conflict of Interest (COI) activities across institution; educate Researchers and IRB Members on institutional policies related to COI
Oversee the Research COI Committee and development of COI Management Plans when conflicts arise
Perform Institutional Review Board (IRB) reviews to ensure compliance with institutional policies and the Association for the Accreditation of Human Research Protection Programs (AAHRPP) 
Conduct research audits as requested by VP of Research Compliance, Clinical Trials Management Office (CTMO), and IRB
Lead our institutional Research Conflict of Interest (COI) Committee; Oversee the development of Research COI Management Plans when conflicts arise.
Responsible for our institution’s annual COI Disclosure process for Leaders, Medical Providers, Residents, and Researchers.
Conduct research audits requested by our institution’s VP of Research Compliance, Clinical Research Management Office (CRMO) and/or Institutional Review Board (IRB) in response to alleged violation of regulations or policies.
Develops research compliance educational programs to contribute to staff knowledge in maintaining an ethical environment, improving internal controls and adhering to applicable rules and regulations.

Extrapolated data, completed case report forms, and ensured timely data submission in accordance with 
Pharmaceutical Sponsors and Contract Research Organizations (CRO).
Collected and processed specimens, imaging documents, and other items required by research protocols. 
Maintain research records in confidential manner according to practice policies, sponsor confidentiality 
agreements, HIPAA guidelines and other regulations.

linkedin_data.name: Alexis Bell Sriram
linkedin_data.headline: Adaptable healthcare operations manager driving operational excellence and patient satisfaction
linkedin_data.summary:
With over a decade of experience in healthcare administration, I have built on my passion for enhancing operational efficiency and service excellence. I have proven expertise in optimizing provider schedules and expanding service lines for high-volume facilities, and demonstrated success in opening new clinic floors, increasing patient volume, and improving revenue cycle efficiency. I am a personable and flexible leader, recognized for fostering collaborative work environments and mentoring emerging leaders to contribute to staff development. I am an accomplished operations manager who is committed to leveraging strong leadership and financial management skills to drive success in a dynamic healthcare setting.

I offer over a decade of hands-on experience coupled with my Bachelor of Social Science (Psychology) degree and pending Master's in Healthcare Administration. And some of the knowledge and skills I have honed include: 
• Healthcare Facility Operations Management
• Financial Management and Budgeting
• Revenue Cycle Management
• Service Line Expansion
• Patient Flow Optimization
• Electronic Health Records Systems Proficiency

I'd also like to share a few of my proudest achievements during my tenure:
 1. Closely collaborated with program directors and physician leadership in the opening of a new clinic floor at Lafayette Center, resulting in a 10% increase in patient volume.
 2. Optimized workflows at one of the largest Multi-Ambulatory Care Centers in the MedStar System to accommodate over 650 patients daily without compromising service quality.
 3. Mentored emerging leaders and facilitated training workshops, which significantly contributed to staff development and operational excellence.

Connect with me if you, too, are passionate about delivering high-quality patient care!

description.text:
As operations manager of the Lafayette Center, I optimize provider schedules to enhance patient flow and collaborate with stakeholders to expand existing service lines and integrate new specialties, ensuring seamless onboarding and service delivery excellence. I manage site financials and budgeting processes for this high-volume facility with over 700 daily patient visits, while fostering a cooperative work environment by liaising with service line managers and mentoring emerging leaders and staff. My overall aim is to position Lafayette as a premier workplace by actively engaging in multidisciplinary meetings and partnering with leaders from other locations.

Some of my key contributions include:
• Partnered with other leaders to successfully open a new clinic floor, boosting patient volume by 10%.
• Streamlined the check-in process by integrating Tonic and Intake Automation software, allowing for a 50% increase in patient volume without the need for additional staff.
• Recruited skilled team leaders and provided ongoing training for front-desk staff, reducing errors in verifying patient eligibility and capturing demographic information by 30%.
• Meticulously manage an annual budget of $2M, closely monitoring expenditure and implementing processes to improve cost control.
• Built strong relationships with various vendors, significantly saving on the cost of hospital consumables and pharmaceuticals by negotiating best prices and favorable contract terms.
• Spearheaded initiatives to foster collaboration across various service lines by implementing monthly touchpoint meetings, improving communication and operational efficiency, which led to the adoption of this process by other Multi Ambulatory Care Centers (MACC).
• Developed and maintained an efficient posting process, establishing it as the gold standard for ambulatory surgical centers within the group, which was later adopted by other MACC sites.

Working for a busy primary care practice I had many responsibilities.  I worked with 4 physicians to make sure that their schedules were correct, answered phone calls, set up follow up appointments for patients, received prior authorizations for various radiology testing, completed both inpatient and outpatient billing.

description.text:
As operations manager of the Lafayette Center, I optimize provider schedules to enhance patient flow and collaborate with stakeholders to expand existing service lines and integrate new specialties, ensuring seamless onboarding and service delivery excellence. I manage site financials and budgeting processes for this high-volume facility with over 700 daily patient visits, while fostering a cooperative work environment by liaising with service line managers and mentoring emerging leaders and staff. My overall aim is to position Lafayette as a premier workplace by actively engaging in multidisciplinary meetings and partnering with leaders from other locations.

Some of my key contributions include:
• Partnered with other leaders to successfully open a new clinic floor, boosting patient volume by 10%.
• Streamlined the check-in process by integrating Tonic and Intake Automation software, allowing for a 50% increase in patient volume without the need for additional staff.
• Recruited skilled team leaders and provided ongoing training for front-desk staff, reducing errors in verifying patient eligibility and capturing demographic information by 30%.
• Meticulously manage an annual budget of $2M, closely monitoring expenditure and implementing processes to improve cost control.
• Built strong relationships with various vendors, significantly saving on the cost of hospital consumables and pharmaceuticals by negotiating best prices and favorable contract terms.
• Spearheaded initiatives to foster collaboration across various service lines by implementing monthly touchpoint meetings, improving communication and operational efficiency, which led to the adoption of this process by other Multi Ambulatory Care Centers (MACC).
• Developed and maintained an efficient posting process, establishing it as the gold standard for ambulatory surgical centers within the group, which was later adopted by other MACC sites.

In this role, I managed the Center's daily operations and implemented policies, procedures, and workflows to enhance patient care and staff efficiency. I oversaw a team of over 40 staff members and handled payroll responsibilities and disciplinaries, as necessary. One of my many responsibilities also included coordinating the onboarding process for new physicians to ensure their seamless integration into the center's practices. I meticulously supervised the revenue cycle and billing processes, and managed deposits, totaling monthly, to maintain financial integrity and accountability.

A few of my main contributions are:
• Increased patient volume by over 50% within a 5-year period, creating a safe and welcoming environment for patients and increasing the number of service providers, which significantly contributed to the growth and success of the center.
• Successfully opened the largest MACC in the MedStar System, project-managing the conversion of a 130,00 square-foot blank space into a fully functional medical facility, establishing all policies and procedures, integrating 15 existing employees, and training over 60 new hires, creating a strong operational foundation from inception.
• Implemented automated systems to optimize various service-line workflows and ensured adherence to existing and newly established quality measures, which led to the center accommodating over 650 patients daily without compromising service quality.
• Enhanced team performance and morale by spearheading monthly wellness initiatives, including a travelling wellness wagon that distributed small gifts and informative resources to staff, which was adopted across the entire MedStar system.

description.text:
Working in this primary care practice, I managed daily operations and supervised 20 staff, ensuring efficient workflow to maintain patient satisfaction and a cohesive team environment. I administered the practice's financial operations, coordinated prior authorizations for imaging studies, and facilitated patient referrals.

In this position, I accomplished the following:
• Successfully onboarded two new physicians, verifying their licenses and credentials and implementing various internal and external promotional marketing strategies, contributing to the practice's growth from an average of eight patients per day to 14 in a six-month period.
• Optimized staff productivity through cross-training initiatives, facilitating cross-coverage and fostering collaboration where team members could support one another, thereby minimizing downtime.
• Enhanced patient care by streamlining the pre-authorization processes for imaging studies, building strong relationships with imaging departments to understand the optimal procedures for obtaining prior authorizations and collaborating with payers through online portals to expedite approvals.
• Streamlined referral procedures by equipping physicians with resources to facilitate patient referrals during consultations and educating patients on using the online portal to manage referrals, resulting in increased patient satisfaction and retention.

Working for a busy primary care practice I had many responsibilities.  I worked with 4 physicians to make sure that their schedules were correct, answered phone calls, set up follow up appointments for patients, received prior authorizations for various radiology testing, completed both inpatient and outpatient billing.

Staffed a 24 hour a day, 365 day a year department.  Made sure appropriate demographics for patients coming into the emergency room was received.  Completed scanning and basic billing for patients seen in the emergency room.  Managed a staff of 30 employees, including payroll, discipline and managing errors.  Helped implement two new systems.

Verified benefits for two busy hospital owned physical therapy practices.  I made sure that insurance was active, received authorization if needed, and made sure that patients did not exceed the number of visit their insurance allowed.  I also did verification for various outpatient radiology testing.
